H0.text: In which country did Queen Isabella secure the throne when her opponents (Carlists) were defeated in 1868, following a civil war between those who wanted a king and those who wanted a queen. Portugal

H1.text: In which country did Queen Isabella secure the throne when her opponents (Carlists) were defeated in 1868, following a civil war between those who wanted a king and those who wanted a queen. Italy

H2.text: In which country did Queen Isabella secure the throne when her opponents (Carlists) were defeated in 1868, following a civil war between those who wanted a king and those who wanted a queen. France

H3.text: In which country did Queen Isabella secure the throne when her opponents (Carlists) were defeated in 1868, following a civil war between those who wanted a king and those who wanted a queen. SPAIN

A4.text: Isabella II was Queen of Spain from 1833 until her deposition in 1868.

A5.text: In September 1868, a naval mutiny began in CÃ¡diz, marking the beginning of the Glorious Revolution.

A6.text: The Glorious Revolution took place in Spain in 1868, resulting in the deposition of Queen Isabella II.

A7.text: In 1868, Queen Isabella II was deposed by a revolution in Spain, ending her reign.

A8.text: In the 1830s and 1840s, Carlism (a reactionary legitimist movement supportive of an alternative Bourbon branch), fought against the government forces supportive of Queen Isabella II's dynastic rights in the Carlist Wars.
